result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus A Rodriguez-Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesus A Rodriguez-Gonzalez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesus A Rodriguez-Gonzalez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 10/26/22 sent electronically to DCJ

3:35 PM Defendant Jesus A Rodriguez-Gonzalez in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Jesus A Rodriguez-Gonzalez.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim J.G. by phone. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 2
The Court sentences Defendant to:

-Days credit for time served:  15 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Kaitlyn BN
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jesus A Rodriguez-Gonzalez in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Jesus A Rodriguez-Gonzalez.  Attorney Tim Verhoff for  Hector Al-Homsi in court for State of Wisconsin. 
IN CUSTODY
Set for plea, sentencing with cases 20CF2603, 21CF2084
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not be on the 2900 block of Hoard St in Madison.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SDR.
Trial Judge - Br 12

The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
